traffic_visible_response: 正在搜索找到 3 篇资料参考The term “China’s Wailing Wall” is sometimes used in a wrong or malicious way by some Western forces to smear and distort China. In fact, there is no such thing in the real sense. However, if it is misinterpreted or misused, the following two aspects may be involved:- **Nanjing Massacre Victims' Name Wall**：The Nanjing Massacre Victims' Name Wall, located in the Memorial Hall of the Victims in Nanjing Massacre by Japanese Invaders, is commonly known as the "Crying Wall" in Chinese. It was designed by Qi Kang, an academician of the Chinese Academy of Sciences. Since its establishment in 1995, the wall has gone through several expansions and now has 10,665 names of the victims engraved on it, symbolizing the 300,000 compatriots massacred by the Japanese army.- **Digital Space Related to Dr. Li Wenliang**：After the death of Dr. Li Wenliang, his Weibo page became a digital gathering place for Chinese netizens. Many people left messages and condolences there, and some Western media wrongly referred to it as "China's Wailing Wall".
